channel.title: Alerts: Alerts
channel.description: RSS feed for the Alerts list.

item.title: Severe fire danger advice for parts of the Pilbara on Wednesday
item.description:
Category: Fire Danger Severe
Alert Summary: A Severe Fire Danger Rating has been forecast for Wednesday 23 November for parts of the Pilbara.
Content:

​A Severe Fire Danger Rating has been forecast for Wednesday 23 November for parts of the Pilbara.

This includes:
• Shire of Exmouth 
These are very hot, dry and windy conditions for a bush or grass fire.
If a fire starts and takes hold:
• It will be unpredictable, move very fast and difficult for firefighters to bring under control.
• Spot fires will start and move quickly. Embers may come from many directions.
If you live in or near bush, high fuel loads or a forested area then you are at risk and need to take action:
• Read through your bushfire survival plan. If you do not have one decide what you will do if a fire starts.
• If you are not prepared to the highest level, leaving bushfire risk areas early in the day is your safest option.
• Homes that are prepared to the highest level, have been constructed to bushfire protection levels and are actively defended may provide safety. You must be physically and mentally prepared to defend in these conditions.
To find out what the Fire Danger Rating means to you visit www.dfes.wa.gov.au or call 9395 9300 during normal office hours.
Check the Fire Danger Rating for your area by visiting www.bom.gov.au or call 1300 659 213 (call charges apply).
Publication Time: 22/11/2016 4:51 PM
Expiration Time: 24/11/2016 12:00 AM
Region: Pilbara

item.title: Severe fire danger advice for parts of the Midwest Gascoyne on Wednesday.
item.description:
Category: Fire Danger Severe
Alert Summary: A Severe Fire Danger Rating has been forecast for Wednesday 22 November for parts of the Midwest Gascoyne.
Content:

​A Severe Fire Danger Rating has been forecast for Wednesday 22 November for parts of the Midwest Gascoyne.

This includes:
• Shire of Carnarvon
• Shire of Shark Bay
• Shire of  Cue
• Shire of  Meekatharra

• Shire of  Mount Magnet

These are very hot, dry and windy conditions for a bush or grass fire.
If a fire starts and takes hold:
• It will be unpredictable, move very fast and difficult for firefighters to bring under control.
• Spot fires will start and move quickly. Embers may come from many directions.
If you live in or near bush, high fuel loads or a forested area then you are at risk and need to take action:
• Read through your bushfire survival plan. If you do not have one decide what you will do if a fire starts.
• If you are not prepared to the highest level, leaving bushfire risk areas early in the day is your safest option.
• Homes that are prepared to the highest level, have been constructed to bushfire protection levels and are actively defended may provide safety. You must be physically and mentally prepared to defend in these conditions.
To find out what the Fire Danger Rating means to you visit www.dfes.wa.gov.au or call 9395 9300 during normal office hours.
Check the Fire Danger Rating for your area by visiting www.bom.gov.au or call 1300 659 213 (call charges apply).

Region: Midwest Gascoyne

item.title: Bushfire ADVICE for people travelling on Eyre Highway in Caiguna in the SHIRE OF DUNDAS
item.description:
Category: Fire
Alert Summary: Bushfire ADVICE for people travelling on Eyre Highway in Caiguna in the SHIRE OF DUNDAS
Content:

​ALERT LEVEL: 


A bushfire ADVICE has been issued for people travelling along Eyre Highway, 20km south east of Caiguna Roadhouse in Caiguna in the SHIRE OF DUNDAS. 

• There is a lot of smoke in the area.

• Although there is no immediate danger you need to be aware and keep up to date in case the situation changes.

• The fire started near Eyre Highway in Caiguna in the SHIRE OF DUNDAS.

• The fire is burning towards Eyre Highway.

WHAT TO DO: 

If driving

• Be extremely careful when driving through the area.

• Turn your headlights on and drive slowly.

• Watch for emergency services personnel and follow their directions.

• If you cannot see clearly, pull over, keep your headlights and hazard lights on, and wait until the smoke clears.

• If you have a respiratory condition and you have been affected by smoke you should contact your local doctor or call Health Direct on 1800 022 222.


BUSHFIRE BEHAVIOUR: 

• The bushfire is moving slowly in a north westerly direction.

• It is a small controllable fire.


ROAD CLOSURES AND CONDITIONS: 

Roads have not been closed.

Motorists are asked to avoid the area, reduce speed and drive carefully due to smoke.


Road information may also be available from Main Roads WA by calling 138 138 or visiting www.mainroads.wa.gov.au or the Shire of Dundas.


WHAT FIREFIGHTERS ARE DOING: 

• Firefighters are monitoring the situation. 


EXTRA INFORMATION: 

• The fire was reported at 02:31 PM on 21 November 2016.

• The cause of the fire is unknown.

• Shire of Dundas is managing the fire.


KEEP UP TO DATE: 


Visit emergency.wa.gov.au, call 13 DFES (13 3337), follow DFES on Twitter @dfes_wa, or listen to news bulletins. 


The next update will be provided by 4pm today unless the situation changes. 


Publication Time: 22/11/2016 11:08 AM
Expiration Time: 22/11/2016 2:25 PM
Region: Goldfields Midlands

item.title: Bushfire ALL CLEAR for people travelling on Eyre Highway in Caiguna in the SHIRE OF DUNDAS
item.description:
Category: Fire
Alert Summary: An ALL CLEAR advice has been issued for people travelling along Eyre Highway, 20km south east of Caiguna Roadhouse in Caiguna in the SHIRE OF DUNDAS.
Content:

​An ALL CLEAR advice has been issued for people travelling along Eyre Highway, 20km south east of Caiguna Roadhouse in Caiguna in the SHIRE OF DUNDAS. 

  • The bushfire is no longer impacting the community in this area.
  • Firefighters will monitor the area for the next few days.
  • The danger has passed but you need to remain vigilant in case the situation changes.

WHAT TO DO: 

  • Drive slowly and with caution due to smoke and emergency services personnel working in the area.


ROAD CLOSURES AND CONDITIONS: 

Roads have not been closed.

Motorists are asked to avoid the area, reduce speed and drive carefully due to smoke.

Road information may also be available from Main Roads WA by calling 138 138 or visiting www.mainroads.wa.gov.au or the Shire of Dundas.


WHAT FIREFIGHTERS ARE DOING: 

  • Firefighters are monitoring the situation. 


EXTRA INFORMATION: 

  • The fire was reported at 02:31 PM on 21 November 2016.
  • The cause of the fire is lightning.
  • Shire of Dundas is managing the fire.

No further updates will be issued. 


Publication Time: 22/11/2016 2:24 PM
Expiration Time: 23/11/2016 8:00 AM
Region: Goldfields Midlands

item.title: Structure Fire in Mount Hawthorn in the CITY OF VINCENT
item.description:
Category: Fire
Alert Summary: There is a Structure Fire on Keats Lane near the intersection of Harrow Street in the CITY OF VINCENT.
Content:

There is a Structure Fire on Keats Lane near the intersection of Harrow Street in the CITY OF VINCENT.

The fire is contained and under control but there is a lot of smoke in the area. 

People bounded by Oxford Street, Anzac Road, Loftus Street and Scarborough Beach Road in Mount Hawthorn may be impacted by smoke.

WHAT TO DO: 

  • As a precautionary measure, people in the area should remain inside, out of the smoke with doors and windows closed. Air conditioners should also be switched off.
  • People should stay away from the area. If you are already in the area take advice from emergency services personnel.
  • Be extremely careful when driving through the area.
  • Turn your headlights on and drive slowly.
  • If you cannot see clearly, pull over, keep your headlights and hazard lights on, and wait until the smoke clears.
  • If you have a respiratory condition and you have been affected by smoke you should contact your local doctor or call Health Direct on 1800 022 222.


ROAD CLOSURES AND CONDITIONS: 

Avoid the area and be aware of fire and emergency servcies personnel working on site.

Scarborough Beach Road from Shakespeare Street to Loftus Street has been closed due to smoke in the area.

Motorists are asked to avoid the area, reduce speed and be aware of fire and other emergency services personnel.

Road information may also be available by calling Main Roads WA on 138 138 or visiting www.mainroads.wa.gov.au 


WHAT FIREFIGHTERS ARE DOING:

  • 30 career Fire and Rescue Service firefighters are attending.
  • Firefighters are on the scene monitoring the situation.


EXTRA INFORMATION:

  • The structure fire has caused significant damage to two houses.
  • The cause of the fire is unknown.

KEEP UP TO DATE: 

Visit emergency.wa.gov.au, call 13 DFES (13 3337), follow DFES on Twitter @dfes_wa, 6PR, or listen to news bulletins.  

Updates will be provided when the situation changes.

Publication Time: 22/11/2016 11:21 AM
Expiration Time: 22/11/2016 11:55 AM
Region: Metro

item.title: Structure Fire in Mount Hawthorn in the CITY OF VINCENT controlled-contained
item.description:
Category: Fire
Alert Summary: The Structure Fire in Mount Hawthorn is now contained and under control and smoke in the area has cleared.
Content:

​The Structure Fire in Mount Hawthorn is now contained and under control and smoke in the area has cleared.

WHAT TO DO: 

  • People in an area bounded by Sarborough Beach road, Keats Lane, Loftus street and Anzac Road will no longer be impacted by smoke.

ROAD CLOSURES AND CONDITIONS: 

Roads have now been reopened.

Motorists are asked to reduce speed and be aware of fire and other emergency services personnel.

Road information may also be available by calling Main Roads WA on 138 138 or visiting www.mainroads.wa.gov.au 


WHAT FIREFIGHTERS ARE DOING: 

  • 30 career Fire and Rescue Service firefighters are attending.
  • Firefighters are on the scene and mopping up.

EXTRA INFORMATION: 

  • The Structure Fire has caused significant damage to two houses.
  • The cause of the fire is unknown


KEEP UP TO DATE: 

Visit emergency.wa.gov.au, call 13 DFES (13 3337), follow DFES on Twitter @dfes_wa, 6PR, or listen to news bulletins.  

No further updates will be issued. 


Publication Time: 22/11/2016 11:52 AM
Expiration Time: 22/11/2016 5:00 PM
Region: Metro

item.title: Severe fire danger advice for parts of the Midwest Gascoyne on Tuesday
item.description:
Category: Fire Danger Severe
Alert Summary: A Severe Fire Danger Rating has been forecast for Tuesday 22 November 2016 for coastal and inland parts of the Gascoyne.
Content:

​A Severe Fire Danger Rating has been forecast for Tuesday 22 November 2016 for coastal and inland parts of the Gascoyne.

This includes: 

  • Shire of Carnarvon 
  • Shire of Shark Bay
  • Shire of  Cue
  • Shire of  Meekatharra
  • Shire of  Menzies – the far western part
  • Shire of  Mount Magnet
  • Shire of  Murchison
  • Shire of  Sandstone
  • Shire of  Upper Gascoyne
  • Shire of  Wiluna – western edge and the south western tip
  • Shire of  Yalgoo


These are very hot, dry and windy conditions for a bush or grass fire.


If a fire starts and takes hold: 

  • It will be unpredictable, move very fast and difficult for firefighters to bring under control. 
  • Spot fires will start and move quickly. Embers may come from many directions. 

If you live in or near bush, high fuel loads or a forested area then you are at risk and need to take action: 

  • Read through your bushfire survival plan. If you do not have one decide what you will do if a fire starts. 
  • If you are not prepared to the highest level, leaving bushfire risk areas early in the day is your safest option. 
  • Homes that are prepared to the highest level, have been constructed to bushfire protection levels and are actively defended may provide safety. You must be physically and mentally prepared to defend in these conditions. 

To find out what the Fire Danger Rating means to you visit www.dfes.wa.gov.au or call 9395 9300 during normal office hours.

Check the Fire Danger Rating for your area by visiting www.bom.gov.au or call 1300 659 213 (call charges apply).


Publication Time: 21/11/2016 4:19 PM
Expiration Time: 23/11/2016 12:00 AM
Region: Midwest Gascoyne

item.title: Waste Facility Fire in Gap Ridge in the CITY OF KARRATHA
item.description:
Category: Fire
Alert Summary: There is a Waste Facility Fire on Pindan Road near the intersection of Exploration Drive in the CITY OF KARRATHA
Content:

​There is a Waste Facility Fire on Pindan Road near the intersection of Exploration Drive in the CITY OF KARRATHA

A fire at a waste facility on Pindan Road in Gap Ridge may result in smoke travelling across the Karratha townsite this evening. The fire has been contained and controlled.
 
People in the Karratha townsite may be impacted by smoke.
 

WHAT TO DO:

  • As a precautionary measure, people in the area should remain inside, out of the smoke or fumes, with doors and windows closed. Air conditioners should also be switched off.
  • People should stay away from the area. If you are already in the area take advice from emergency services personnel.
    People with medical concerns should contact their local doctor or call Health Direct on 1800 022 222.
 
ROAD CLOSURES AND CONDITIONS:
Roads have not been closed.
Motorists are asked to avoid the area, reduce speed and be aware of fire and other emergency services personnel.
Road information may also be available by calling Main Roads WA on 138 138 or visiting www.mainroads.wa.gov.au or the City of Karratha.


WHAT FIREFIGHTERS ARE DOING:

  • Firefighters are on the scene mopping up the fire.
  • Nine Karratha Volunteer Fire and Rescue Service firefighters are attending.

 

EXTRA INFORMATION:
  • The incident was reported at 19/11/2016 18:50:00.
  • The cause of the fire is unknown

 

KEEP UP TO DATE:
Visit emergency.wa.gov.au, call 13 DFES (13 3337), follow DFES on Twitter @dfes_wa, or listen to news bulletins. 
Updates will be provided when the situation changes.
Publication Time: 19/11/2016 8:43 PM
Expiration Time: 19/11/2016 9:35 PM
Region: Pilbara

item.title: Waste Facility Fire in Gap Ridge in the CITY OF KARRATHA extinguished
item.description:
Category: Fire

Content:

The Waste Facility Fire in Gap Ridge is now extinguished.

WHAT TO DO:
  • People in the Karratha townsite will no longer be impacted by smoke.

ROAD CLOSURES AND CONDITIONS:
Roads have not been closed.
Motorists are asked to avoid the area, reduce speed and be aware of fire and other emergency services personnel.

item.title: Severe fire danger advice for parts of the Goldfields Midlands on Sunday
item.description:
Category: Fire Danger Extreme
Alert Summary: A Severe Fire Danger Rating has been forecast for Sunday 20 November 2016 for parts of the Goldfields.
Content:

​A Severe Fire Danger Rating has been forecast for Sunday 20 November 2016 for parts of the Goldfields.

This includes: 

  • City of Kalgoorlie-Boulder local government area - western part  
  • Shire of Coolgardie
  • Shire of Dundas - western part
  • Shire of Laverton - south western corner
  • Shire of Leonora
  • Shire of Menzies - central part
  • Shire of Sandstone - part adjacent to Leonora Shire
  • Shire of Wiluna - south western corner

 

These are very hot, dry and windy conditions for a bush or grass fire.
 

If a fire starts and takes hold:

  • It will be unpredictable, move very fast and difficult for firefighters to bring under control. 
  • Spot fires will start and move quickly. Embers may come from many directions.

If you live in or near bush, high fuel loads or a forested area then you are at risk and need to take action: 
  • Read through your bushfire survival plan. If you do not have one decide what you will do if a fire starts.
  • If you are not prepared to the highest level, leaving bushfire risk areas early in the day is your safest option.
  • Homes that are prepared to the highest level, have been constructed to bushfire protection levels and are actively
  • defended may provide safety. You must be physically and mentally prepared to defend in these conditions.

To find out what the Fire Danger Rating means to you visit www.dfes.wa.gov.au or call 9395 9300 during normal office hours.
Check the Fire Danger Rating for your area by visiting www.bom.gov.au or call 1300 659 213 (call charges apply).
Publication Time: 19/11/2016 4:19 PM
Expiration Time: 21/11/2016 12:00 AM
Region: Goldfields Midlands

item.title: Bushfire ADVICE for Gibb River-Kalumbaru Road near Drysdale River in SHIRE OF WYNDHAM-EAST KIMBERLEY
item.description:
Category: Fire
Alert Summary: A bushfire ADVICE has been issued for people driving along Gibb River-Kalumbaru Road between Drysdale River Station and Theda Station in the Shire of Wyndham-East Kimberley.
Content:

A bushfire ADVICE has been issued for people driving along Gibb River-Kalumbaru Road between Drysdale River Station and Theda Station in the Shire of Wyndham-East Kimberley.

  • There is no threat to lives or homes.
  • There is a lot of smoke in the area.
  • Although there is no immediate danger you need to be aware and keep up to date in case the situation changes.
  • The fire started near Gibb River-Kalumbaru Road and Drysdale River.
WHAT TO DO:
If driving
  • Be extremely careful when driving through the area.
  • Turn your headlights on and drive slowly.
  • Watch for emergency services personnel and follow their directions.
  • If you cannot see clearly, pull over, keep your headlights and hazard lights on, and wait until the smoke clears.
  • If you have a respiratory condition and you have been affected by smoke you should contact your local doctor or call Health Direct on 1800 022 222.

 

BUSHFIRE BEHAVIOUR:
  • It is a small controllable fire.
  • The fire is currently stationary.

ROAD CLOSURES AND CONDITIONS:
Roads have not been closed.
Motorists are asked to avoid the area, reduce speed and drive carefully due to smoke.
Road information may also be available from Main Roads WA by calling 138 138 or visiting www.mainroads.wa.gov.au or the Shire of Wyndham-East Kimberley.

WHAT FIREFIGHTERS ARE DOING:
  • Firefighters are monitoring the situation.

EXTRA INFORMATION:
  • The cause of the fire is lightning.
  • DFES is managing the fire.

KEEP UP TO DATE:
Visit emergency.wa.gov.au, call 13 DFES (13 3337), follow DFES on Twitter @dfes_wa, or listen to news bulletins.
The next update will be provided by 4pm today unless the situation changes.
 
Publication Time: 19/11/2016 10:15 AM
Expiration Time: 19/11/2016 3:25 PM
Region: Kimberley

item.title: Smoke Alert for south of Mandurah to Yalgorup National Park including Dawesville and Melros in the City of Mandurah
item.description:
Category: Smoke Alert
Alert Summary: The Department of Parks and Wildlife has issued a smoke alert for people within these areas and travelling on Old Coast Road between Mandurah and Yalgorup National Park.
Content:

​The Department of Parks and Wildlife has issued a smoke alert for people within these areas and travelling on Old Coast Road between Mandurah and Yalgorup National Park. 

The smoke is from a prescribed burn being undertaken today in Yalgorup National Park, 3km south of Dawesville to manage bushfire risk and for nature conservation.

The smoke is expected to clear overnight.

WHAT TO DO:   

 

  • If the smoke is particularly thick, it is recommended people shut doors and windows and turn off air-conditioners.
  • Smoke may reduce visibility on some roads and motorists should take care, turn on headlights and travel at appropriate speeds when travelling in these areas.
  • People with asthma and pre-existing respiratory or cardiovascular illnesses should follow their pre-prepared treatment plan.
  • People with conditions exacerbated by smoke should take precautions in line with their medical advice for these circumstances.

 

 

More information on prescribed burns can be found at www.dpaw.wa.gov.au

KEEP UP TO DATE: 

Visit http://emergency.wa.gov.au, follow us on Facebook and Twitter, or listen to news bulletins 

The next update will be issued when the situation changes 

Publication Time: 18/11/2016 2:05 PM
Expiration Time: 19/11/2016 11:10 AM
Region: Metro

item.title: Bushfire ADVICE for Gibb River-Kalumbaru Road near Drysdale River in SHIRE OF WYNDHAM-EAST KIMBERLEY
item.description:
Category: Fire
Alert Summary: A bushfire ADVICE has been issued for people driving along Gibb River-Kalumbaru Road between Drysdale River Station and Theda Station in the Shire of Wyndham-East Kimberley.
Content:

​A bushfire ADVICE has been issued for people driving along Gibb River-Kalumbaru Road between Drysdale River Station and Theda Station in the Shire of Wyndham-East Kimberley. 

• There is no threat to lives or homes.

• There is a lot of smoke in the area.

• Although there is no immediate danger you need to be aware and keep up to date in case the situation changes.

• The fire started near Gibb River-Kalumbaru Road and Drysdale River.

WHAT TO DO: 

If driving

• Be extremely careful when driving through the area.

• Turn your headlights on and drive slowly.

• Watch for emergency services personnel and follow their directions.

• If you cannot see clearly, pull over, keep your headlights and hazard lights on, and wait until the smoke clears.

• If you have a respiratory condition and you have been affected by smoke you should contact your local doctor or call Health Direct on 1800 022 222.


BUSHFIRE BEHAVIOUR: 

• It is a small controllable fire.

• The fire is currently stationary.


ROAD CLOSURES AND CONDITIONS: 

Roads have not been closed.

Motorists are asked to avoid the area, reduce speed and drive carefully due to smoke.


Road information may also be available from Main Roads WA by calling 138 138 or visiting www.mainroads.wa.gov.au OR SHIRE OF WYNDHAM-EAST KIMBERLEY.


WHAT FIREFIGHTERS ARE DOING: 

• Firefighters are monitoring the situation. 


EXTRA INFORMATION: 

• The cause of the fire is lightning.

• DFES is managing the fire.


KEEP UP TO DATE: 


Visit emergency.wa.gov.au, call 13 DFES (13 3337), follow DFES on Twitter @dfes_wa, or listen to news bulletins. 


The next update to be provided by 11am tomorrow unless the situation changes. 


Publication Time: 18/11/2016 3:16 PM
Expiration Time: 19/11/2016 10:15 AM
Region: Kimberley

item.title: Severe fire danger advice for parts of the Midwest Gascoyne on Saturday
item.description:
Category: Fire Danger Rating
Alert Summary: A Severe Fire Danger Rating has been forecast for Saturday 19 November for inland and coastal parts of the Gascoyne and inland parts of the Central West in the Midwest Gascoyne.
Content:

​A Severe Fire Danger Rating has been forecast for Saturday 19 November for inland and coastal parts of the Gascoyne and inland parts of the Central West in the Midwest Gascoyne.

This includes: 

• Shire of  Carnarvon 

• Shire of  Cue

• Shire of  Meekatharra

• Shire of  Menzies – the far western part

• Shire of  Mount Magnet

• Shire of  Murchison

• Shire of  Sandstone

• Shire of  Shark Bay 

• Shire of  Upper Gascoyne

• Shire of  Wiluna – western edge and the south western tip

• Shire of  Yalgoo

• City of Greater Geraldton – inland part

• Shire of Chapman Valley – inland part

• Shire of Mingenew

• Shire of Morawa

• Shire of Northampton – inland part

These are very hot, dry and windy conditions for a bush or grass fire.

If a fire starts and takes hold: 

• It will be unpredictable, move very fast and difficult for firefighters to bring under control. 

• Spot fires will start and move quickly. Embers may come from many directions. 

If you live in or near bush, high fuel loads or a forested area then you are at risk and need to take action: 

• Read through your bushfire survival plan. If you do not have one decide what you will do if a fire starts. 

• If you are not prepared to the highest level, leaving bushfire risk areas early in the day is your safest option. 

• Homes that are prepared to the highest level, have been constructed to bushfire protection levels and are actively defended may provide safety. You must be physically and mentally prepared to defend in these conditions. 

To find out what the Fire Danger Rating means to you visit www.dfes.wa.gov.au or call 9395 9300 during normal office hours.

Publication Time: 18/11/2016 4:55 PM
Expiration Time: 20/11/2016 12:00 AM
Region: Midwest Gascoyne

Content:

​Bushfire ADVICE for Gibb River-Kalumbaru Road near Drysdale River in SHIRE OF WYNDHAM-EAST KIMBERLEY

A bushfire ADVICE has been issued for people driving along Gibb River-Kalumbaru Road between Drysdale River Station and Theda Station in the Shire of Wyndham-East Kimberley. 

• There is no threat to lives or homes.

• There is a lot of smoke in the area.

If driving

• Be extremely careful when driving through the area.

• Watch for emergency services personnel and follow their directions.

• If you cannot see clearly, pull over, keep your headlights and hazard lights on, and wait until the smoke clears.

• If you have a respiratory condition and you have been affected by smoke you should contact your local doctor or call Health Direct on 1800 022 222.


BUSHFIRE BEHAVIOUR: 

• The bushfire is moving slowly in a north easterly direction.

• It is a small controllable fire.


ROAD CLOSURES AND CONDITIONS:

Road information may also be available from Main Roads WA by calling 138 138 or visiting www.mainroads.wa.gov.au OR SHIRE OF WYNDHAM-EAST KIMBERLEY.


WHAT FIREFIGHTERS ARE DOING:

EXTRA INFORMATION:

item.description:

Content:

If a fire starts and takes hold: 

  • It will be unpredictable, move very fast and difficult for firefighters to bring under control.

If you live in or near bush, high fuel loads or a forested area then you are at risk and need to take action: 

  • Read through your bushfire survival plan. If you do not have one decide what you will do if a fire starts. 
  • If you are not prepared to the highest level, leaving bushfire risk areas early in the day is your safest option.

item.title: Cancellation of thunderstorms warning for parts of the Midwest-Gascoyne and Goldfields-Midlands
item.description:
Category: Storm
Alert Summary: As at 17/11/2016 22:03:00 the Bureau of Meteorology advises the thunderstorms warning in far eastern Midwest-Gascoyne and north-eastern Goldfields-Midlands, including Warburton and surrounding areas has been cancelled.
Content:

As at 17/11/2016 22:03:00 the Bureau of Meteorology advises the thunderstorms warning in far eastern Midwest-Gascoyne and north-eastern Goldfields-Midlands, including Warburton and surrounding areas has been cancelled.

The immediate threat of severe thunderstorms has passed. Severe thunderstorms are no longer occurring in Western Australia.
 
To date, DFES has received minimal calls for assistance.

WEATHER DETAILS:
At 17/11/2016 22:03:00 the Bureau of Meteorology advised the immediate threat of severe thunderstorms has passed, but the situation will continue to be monitored and further warnings will be issued if necessary.

ROAD CLOSURES AND CONDITIONS:

Roads have not been closed.
Take extra care on the roads and do not drive into water of unknown depth and current.
Road information may also be available by calling Main Roads WA on 138 138 or visiting www.mainroads.wa.gov.au or your local Shire.
 
WHAT TO DO:
DFES advises that people should:
  • Keep away from flooded drains, rivers, streams and waterways.
  • Be careful of fallen trees, damaged buildings and debris.
  • Be careful of fallen power lines. They are dangerous and should always be treated as live.
  • Assess your home, car and property for damage.
 
IF YOU NEED ASSISTANCE:
  • If your home has been badly damaged by a storm, call the SES on 132 500
  • In a life threatening situation call 000

After a storm SES volunteers make temporary repairs to homes that have been badly damaged, such as roofs that have been ripped off or large fallen trees on homes or cars. Please contact your insurance company to organise permanent repairs.
KEEP UP TO DATE:

Visit emergency.wa.gov.au, call 13 DFES (13 3337), follow DFES on Twitter @dfes_wa, or listen to news bulletins. 
No further updates will be issued.
Publication Time: 17/11/2016 10:37 PM
Expiration Time: 18/11/2016 8:10 AM
Region: Midwest Gascoyne, Goldfields Midlands

item.title: Take action with thunderstorms coming in parts of the Midwest-Gascoyne and Goldfields-Midlands
item.description:
Category: Storm
Alert Summary: If you live in an area in far eastern Midwest-Gascoyne and north-eastern Goldfields-Midlands you should take action and stay safe with more thunderstorms to come.
Content:

If you live in an area in far eastern Midwest-Gascoyne and north-eastern Goldfields-Midlands you should take action and stay safe with more thunderstorms to come.

This includes people in Warburton and surrounding areas.
This weather is not unusual for this time of year, but could damage homes and make travel dangerous.
 
WHAT TO DO:
DFES advises you to:
  • If outside find safe shelter away from trees, powerlines, storm water drains and streams.
  • Close your curtains and blinds, and stay inside away from windows.
  • Unplug electrical appliances and avoid using landline telephones if there is lightning.
  • If there is flooding, create your own sandbags by using pillow cases filled with sand and place them around doorways to protect your home.
  • If boating, swimming or surfing leave the water.
IF DRIVING:
  • Do not drive into water of unknown depth and current.
  • Slow down, turn your lights on and keep a safe distance from other drivers.
  • Be alert and watch for hazards on the road such as fallen powerlines and loose debris.
  • If it is raining heavily and you cannot see, pull over and park with your hazard lights on until the rain clears.
  • Take care in areas that have been flooded and be careful driving on gravel roads as surfaces will be slippery and muddy, and vehicles could become bogged.
People are being urged to do what they can to help themselves, if it is safe to do so, before calling the SES for assistance

WEATHER DETAILS:
Bureau of Meteorology advised severe thunderstorms are likely to produce damaging winds, large hailstones and heavy rainfall that may lead to flash flooding in the warning area for the next few hours, with the chance of severe thunderstorms easing during the evening. Storms could cause damage to homes and property. If storms develop they are likely to be more intense than usual and dangerous weather conditions may occur in some parts of the warning area.

ROAD CLOSURES AND CONDITIONS:

Roads have not been closed.
Take extra care on the roads and do not drive into water of unknown depth and current.
Road information may also be available by calling Main Roads WA on 138 138 or visiting www.mainroads.wa.gov.au or your local Shire.

IF YOU NEED ASSISTANCE:
  • If your home has been badly damaged by a storm, call the SES on 132 500
  • In a life threatening situation call 000

After a storm SES volunteers make temporary repairs to homes that have been badly damaged, such as roofs that have been ripped off or large fallen trees on homes or cars. Please contact your insurance company to organise permanent repairs.
 
KEEP UP TO DATE:

Visit emergency.wa.gov.au, call 13 DFES (13 3337), follow DFES on Twitter @dfes_wa, or listen to news bulletins. 
Updates will be provided when the situation changes.
Publication Time: 17/11/2016 8:28 PM
Expiration Time: 17/11/2016 10:40 PM
Region: Midwest Gascoyne, Goldfields Midlands

item.title: Take action with thunderstorms coming in parts of the Midwest-Gascoyne and Goldfields-Midlands
item.description:
Category: Storm
Alert Summary: ​Take action with thunderstorms coming in parts of the Midwest-Gascoyne and Goldfields-Midlands
Content:

If you live in an area near far eastern Midwest-Gascoyne and far northern Goldfields-Midlands you should take action and stay safe with more thunderstorms to come.

This includes people in and around south of Parngurr, east of Carnegie and surrounding areas. 

This weather is not unusual for this time of year, but could damage homes and make travel dangerous. 

WHAT TO DO:

DFES advises you to:

If outside find safe shelter away from trees, powerlines, storm water drains and streams.

Close your curtains and blinds, and stay inside away from windows.

Unplug electrical appliances and avoid using landline telephones if there is lightning.

If there is flooding, create your own sandbags by using pillow cases filled with sand and place them around doorways to protect your home.

If boating, swimming or surfing leave the water.

IF DRIVING:

Do not drive into water of unknown depth and current.

Slow down, turn your lights on and keep a safe distance from other drivers.

Be alert and watch for hazards on the road such as fallen powerlines and loose debris.

If it is raining heavily and you cannot see, pull over and park with your hazard lights on until the rain clears.

Take care in areas that have been flooded and be careful driving on gravel roads as surfaces will be slippery and muddy, and vehicles could become bogged.

People are being urged to do what they can to help themselves, if it is safe to do so, before calling the SES for assistance


WEATHER DETAILS:

Bureau of Meteorology advised Severe thunderstorms are likely to produce large hailstones, damaging winds and heavy rainfall that may lead to flash flooding in the warning during this afternoon. Storms could cause damage to homes and property. If storms develop they are likely to be more intense than usual and dangerous weather conditions may occur in some parts of the warning area.


ROAD CLOSURES AND CONDITIONS:

Roads have not been closed.

Take extra care on the roads and do not drive into water of unknown depth and current.


Road information may also be available by calling Main Roads WA on 138 138 or visiting www.mainroads.wa.gov.au or your local Shire.


WHAT EMERGENCY SERVICES ARE DOING:

DFES is monitoring the situation.


IF YOU NEED ASSISTANCE:

If your home has been badly damaged by a storm, call the SES on 132 500

In a life threatening situation call 000

 

After a storm SES volunteers make temporary repairs to homes that have been badly damaged, such as roofs that have been ripped off or large fallen trees on homes or cars. Please contact your insurance company to organise permanent repairs.

KEEP UP TO DATE:

Visit emergency.wa.gov.au, call 13 DFES (13 3337), follow DFES on Twitter @dfes_wa, listen to ABC Local Radio, or news bulletins. 


Updates will be provided when the situation changes.



Publication Time: 17/11/2016 12:01 PM
Expiration Time: 17/11/2016 8:30 PM
Region: Midwest Gascoyne, Goldfields Midlands
